alert.note: Alert for Kemper; Lauderdale; Leake; Neshoba; Newton; Scott (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 15 at 9:07AM CDT until June 15 at 12:30PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Leake County in central Mississippi... Northeastern Scott County in central Mississippi... Southern Kemper County in east central Mississippi... Northern Lauderdale County in east central Mississippi... Southern Neshoba County in east central Mississippi... Northern Newton County in east central Mississippi... * Until 1230 PM CDT. * At 907 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Meridian, Carthage, Union, Collinsville, Walnut Grove, Marion, Conehatta, Toomsuba, Tucker, Meridian Station, Standing Pine, Lauderdale, Sebastopol, Porterville, Herbert Springs, House, Duffee, Martin, Little Rock and Damascus. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Kemper; Lauderdale; Leake; Neshoba; Newton; Scott
